title: Weekly Update and Report Card Distribution
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
Friday 

November 

6, 

2025

Friday November 6, 2025
Another great week at Kramer! Colder temps moving in next week so make sure the kids bundle up! Report cards come home next Friday 11/14

summary: Week ending November 6, 2025 at Kramer. **Colder temperatures** expected next week, so students should dress warmly. **Report cards will be distributed on Friday, November 14th**.

title: Talawanda Food Pantry and Resources
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
TALAWANDA 

FOOD 

RESOURCES

TALAWANDA FOOD RESOURCES

KRAMER FREE PANTRY
The food pantry in front of Kramer is stocked! Please take any items you may need for your family. Talawanda has many resources available to help in a time of need. Please contact Chelsea Pike at 513-273-3511 for any needs you or your family may have.If you would like to donate to the pantry, contact Chelsea or drop off donations to the Kramer office.

OTHER TALAWANDA FREE RESOURCES
SEE IMAGES BELOW FOR MORE INFORMATION

zoom_out_map
                








zoom_out_map

summary: The **Kramer Free Pantry** is located at the entrance of Kramer and is stocked with free food and hygiene items for all students, including cereal, fruit, veggies, peanut butter, spaghetti, mac and cheese, soup, shampoo, and toothbrushes. Students can take any items they need for their families. For questions, donations, or to access additional Talawanda family resources, contact **Chelsea Pike** (Kramer Social Worker) at **513-273-3511** or **pikec@talawanda.org**, or drop donations at the Kramer office.

title: PTG Meeting Rescheduled and Community Updates
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
zoom_out_map
            
The Oxford Lions Club Sight Saving Committee is collecting used eyeglasses (including sunglasses), as well as glasses cases! These glasses and cases are donated all over the world to children who are in need. The lenses and frames from the donated glasses are modified to meet individual children's eye needs. Every year, Oxford Lions Club collects and sends 900-plus pairs of glasses to children in need!Please send any glasses donations to Betsy Beaton (Marshall Elementary School) or Shaunna Tafelski (Board Office) by the beginning of December. We are happy to swing by and pick up glasses donations or they can be dropped off at Marshall or the Board Office. Thank you for supporting the Oxford Lions Club! :)

*PTG*

*PTG*

Please note that the November 18th PTG meeting is being RESCHEDULED to Tuesday, December 2nd at 7 pm (virtual meeting). This move allows interested members to attend the November 18th seminar titled "Building a Tech Healthy Household" in the THS auditorium from 6 to 7:30 pm. Thank you for your patience!

KRAMER 

LOST 

& 

FOUND

KRAMER LOST & FOUND

zoom_out_map
                








zoom_out_map
                








zoom_out_map

zoom_out_map
            
Read At Home
Attention Kindergarten, 1st, and 2nd grade families: RAH begins on Wednesday September 24th. This will be our first reward day, so please return your RAH sheet by Wednesday!Kramer RAH (Reading At Home) is a voluntary program from K-2nd graders that builds a home-school connection by rewarding students for reading at home. Each week students record the books they've read and turn-in record sheets for rewards. Rewards alternate between a student selected book and a small prize.

zoom_out_map
            
Have you connected your Kroger Rewards card to the Kramer PTG yet? Each account can be connected to ONE nonprofit. When you use this feature, Kroger donates a percentage of your expenses to our PTG. You just have to sign up once! https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards

summary: The **November 18th PTG meeting has been rescheduled to Tuesday, December 2nd at 7 PM** (virtual meeting). This allows members to attend the "Building a Tech Healthy Household" seminar on November 18th at THS auditorium (6-7:30 PM). Additional updates include: Oxford Lions Club collecting used eyeglasses and cases for children in need (donate by early December to Betsy Beaton at Marshall Elementary or Shaunna Tafelski at Board Office), Kramer's Read At Home (RAH) program for K-2nd graders with first reward day September 24th, and a reminder to link your **Kroger Rewards card** to Kramer PTG at https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards.

title: November 2025 Lunch Menu Available
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
*NOVEMBER 

LUNCH 

MENU*

*NOVEMBER LUNCH MENU*

summary:
The **Kramer Elementary November 2025 lunch menu** features daily meal options with a choice of milk included. Notable items include:
- **Monday, November 3**: Fish Sandwich or Popcorn Shrimp, Fish Nuggets, Homestyle Baked Beans, Celery Sticks with Ranch, Mixed Fruit
- **Tuesday, November 4**: No School
- **Wednesday, November 5**: Beef Pretzel Dog, Seasoned Green Beans, Fresh Cucumber Slices with Ranch, Fresh Grapes
- **Thursday, November 6**: National Nacho Day - Tortilla Chips, Warm Cheese Cup & Salsa, Taco Fiesta Black Beans, Salsa or Marinara Cup, Pineapple Tidbits
- **Friday, November 7**: 4x6 Rectangle Cheese Pizza, Honey Glazed Carrots, Fresh Romaine Garden Salad, Frozen Fruit Sidekick
- **Monday, November 18**: Holiday Meal - Roast Turkey and Gravy, Garlic Knot Roll, Mashed Potatoes, Seasoned Green Beans, Pumpkin Applesauce
- **November 24-28**: Thanksgiving Break - No School

Menu is subject to change based on product availability.

PUSH provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs. Call Jeanne or Sabrina at 513-523-8100 for more information. Application is attached. Http://www.push-oxford.org/

summary:
The **Community Page** features local resources and upcoming school events. **PUSH** (People United for Self Help) provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs - call 513-523-8100 or visit http://www.push-oxford.org/. View the full community events page at the link above. 

**Key upcoming dates include:**
- **No School:** Nov 4 (Professional Development), Nov 24-28 (Thanksgiving Break), Dec 22-Jan 6 (Winter Break)
- **Music Concerts:** Nov 12 (4th Grade), Dec 3 (5th Grade), Feb 25 (3rd Grade), Mar 10 (2nd Grade)
- **Special Events:** Mother/Son Dance (Jan 31), Field Day (May 8), Last Day of School (May 21)

Full calendar details are listed in the original post.

title: Halloween Celebration and Lost & Found Reminder
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
zoom_out_map
            
Happy Halloween!What an interesting week at Kramer Elementary! You could tell the kids were ready to celebrate today. Thank you to all of our parents and volunteers who came in to help with class parties and view our parade!Please see the PTG section below regarding our lost and found. We have accumulated quite the pile! Check the pictures below or come in to the office to see if anything belongs to your student. Anything left after Thanksgiving break will be donated.** NO SCHOOL TUESDAY 11/4 FOR ELECTION DAY**We hope everyone has a great weekend!

summary:
Kramer Elementary celebrated Halloween this week with class parties and a parade. Thank you to all parents and volunteers who helped! **Important reminders:**
- Check the **lost and found** - there's a large pile of items. View photos in the newsletter or visit the office. Unclaimed items will be donated after Thanksgiving break.
- **No school Tuesday, November 4th** for Election Day.

event_info.title: No School - Election Day

title: Unplug and Play Event at Kramer Playground
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
Unplug 

and 

Play 

Event 

- 

11/5/2025

Unplug and Play Event - 11/5/2025
Mark your calendar for this fun event planned by our Unplug and Play group!

*PTG*

*PTG*

KRAMER 

LOST 

& 

FOUND

KRAMER LOST & FOUND

zoom_out_map
                








zoom_out_map
                








zoom_out_map

zoom_out_map
            
Read At Home
Attention Kindergarten, 1st, and 2nd grade families: RAH begins on Wednesday September 24th. This will be our first reward day, so please return your RAH sheet by Wednesday!Kramer RAH (Reading At Home) is a voluntary program from K-2nd graders that builds a home-school connection by rewarding students for reading at home. Each week students record the books they've read and turn-in record sheets for rewards. Rewards alternate between a student selected book and a small prize.

zoom_out_map
            
Have you connected your Kroger Rewards card to the Kramer PTG yet? Each account can be connected to ONE nonprofit. When you use this feature, Kroger donates a percentage of your expenses to our PTG. You just have to sign up once! https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards

summary: **Unplug & Play Kramer** is a flashlight fun event at dusk on **Wednesday, November 5, 2025** from **5:30-7:00 PM** at the **Kramer playground**. Kids receive a flashlight and engage in independent creative play while parents relax and chat with other parents and staff. Bring a lawn chair! Additional items include: a PTG meeting on **Tuesday, December 2nd at 7PM** (virtual), a **LaRosa's Pizza fundraiser on Thursday, November 13 from 4PM-close** (mention Kramer on receipt), and **Reading At Home (RAH) program** for K-2nd graders starting September 24th. Connect your **Kroger Rewards card** to Kramer PTG at https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards to support the school.
